data.title: Fountain Memorial Funeral Home & Cemetery
data.meta_description: View The Obituary For Gerard "Jay" Bienvenu. Please join us in Loving, Sharing and Memorializing Gerard "Jay" Bienvenu on this permanent online memorial.
data.text:
Gerard "Jay" Bienvenu

November 9, 1918 - May 18, 2008

Funeral services will be held Wednesday, May 21, 2008, at 2:00 p.m. at Fountain Memorial Funeral Home for Mr. Gerard Joseph “Jay” Bienvenu, 89, who passed away Sunday, May 18, 2008, at Cornerstone South Infirmary in Lafayette.

Entombment will follow in Fountain Memorial Cemetery in Lafayette.

Deacon Timothy Maragos, deacon at Our Lady of Fatima Catholic Church, will conduct services.

Mr. Bienvenu was born November 9, 1918. He was a native of St. Martinville and was a long-time resident of Lafayette. Jay was a graduate of Southwest Louisiana Institute, Class of 1946, and did his post-graduate work at LSU. He served in the U.S. Army Air Corps for six years during World War II. Jay was decorated with five Bronze Stars and was recalled in 1951 during the Korean War. Jay met his wife Agnes “Nancy” Welsh in London, while he served as a Lieutenant for the U.S. Intelligence Department and Nancy served for the British Army.

Jay later enrolled as a United States Treasury Agent for the Internal Revenue Service and retired after 39 years of service with that agency. During his employment, he received the Albert Gallatin Award from the Secretary of the U.S. Treasury Dept. for “esteem held by the Department”. Jay served his country in his employment and through his military service for a total of 49 years. He was a member of Our Lady of Fatima Catholic Church in Lafayette, and belonged to the Our Lady of Fatima 50+ Club. Jay also belonged to the Association of Retired Federal Employees.

Gerard is survived by his five children, one son Terrence “Terry” Bienvenu, of Lafayette, and four daughters, Sheila Lawler and her husband Bruce, of San Bruno, CA, Nicole “Niki” Cooper and her husband Roy, of Youngsville, Denise Bienvenu and her husband Salah Mansour, of Lafayette, and Melanie Martin and her husband James, also of Lafayette; five grandchildren, Phillip and Christy Cooper, of Lafayette, Malcolm “Max” Martin, of Pearland, Texas, Lilah Mansour, of Oklahoma City, OK, and Ameara Mansour, of Minneapolis, MN; and three great-grandchildren, Alex Martin, Cole Cooper, and Amelie Kentor. He will be deeply missed by all who loved him.

He was preceded in death by his beloved wife Agnes “Nancy” Bienvenu, his parents Albert “Bob” Bienvenu, of St. Martinville and the former Marie Peck of Lafayette, one sister Lucille Bienvenu Simon, one brother Robert G. Bienvenu, and seven half-brothers and half-sisters.

The family requests that visiting hours at Fountain Memorial Funeral Home be observed from 11 a.m. until 7 p.m. Tuesday, May 20, 2008, resuming at 8 a.m. Wednesday, May 21, 2008 until time of services.

Active pallbearers will be Mr. Bienvenu’s family Terrence Bienvenu, Bruce Lawler, Roy Cooper, Salah Mansour, Jimmy Martin, Phillip Cooper and Malcolm Martin.

Honorary pallbearers are Ernest Breaux, Alex Martin, Cole Cooper, Byron Kentor, Brett Hemes and Michael Parks.

A special thank you to Cornerstone South Infirmary, the staff of Kingsley Place Assisted Living, Journey Hospice, Hospice of Acadiana and his physicians for the compassionate care given to Mr. Bienvenu during his time of illness.

In lieu of flowers, please make memorials in Mr. Bienvenu’s name to Hospice of Acadiana, and/or the local chapter of the American Heart Association, 312 Guilbeau Road, Suite 6C, Lafayette, LA 70506.

Fountain Memorial Funeral Home and Cemetery, (337) 981-7098, 1010 Pandora Street, Lafayette, is in charge of arrangements.
